com.ausregistry.jtoolkit2.session
Class TLSContext

java.lang.Object
  com.ausregistry.jtoolkit2.session.TLSContext

public class TLSContext
extends java.lang.Object

This defines the operations or actions for establishing a TLS Version 1 based context.

Uses the maintenance, debug, support and user level loggers.

TLSContext

public TLSContext(java.lang.String keystore,
                  java.lang.String keypass,
                  java.lang.String truststore,
                  java.lang.String trustpass,
                  java.lang.String type,
                  java.lang.String algorithm)
           throws KeyStoreNotFoundException,
                  KeyStoreReadException,
                  java.security.KeyStoreException,
                  java.security.cert.CertificateException,
                  java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException,
                  java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                  java.security.KeyManagementException
Instantiates a new TLS context.

Parameters:
keystore - the filename of the key store to be used for the context
keypass - the password applied to the key store
truststore - the filename of the trust store that is to be used for the key store
trustpass - the password used in the trust store
type - the key store type
algorithm - the algorithm
Throws:
KeyStoreNotFoundException - the key store not found exception
KeyStoreReadException - the key store read exception
java.security.KeyStoreException - the key store exception
java.security.cert.CertificateException - the certificate exception
java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException - the unrecoverable key exception
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - the no such algorithm exception
java.security.KeyManagementException - the key management exception

Parameters:

port - the port
soTimeout - the socket timeout
Returns:

Throws:

createHttpsUrlConnection

public javax.net.ssl.HttpsURLConnection createHttpsUrlConnection(java.lang.String url,
                                                                 java.lang.Integer connectionTimeout)
                                                          throws java.io.IOException
Creates a Https connection to the specified URL connection.

Parameters:
url - the URL to establish a HTTPS connection to
connectionTimeout - connection timeout value to be used in milliseconds
Returns:
HTTPS URL connection
Throws:
java.io.IOException - in case of a malformed URL or an IO exception occurring while trying to open a connection
